etymologies: mid 17th century: probably via Malay from Chinese (Min) te; related to Mandarin chá. Compare with char

definitions: a hot drink made by infusing the dried crushed leaves of the tea plant in boiling water
shortDefinitions: hot drink made from leaves of tea plant

definitions: the dried leaves used to make tea

examples.text: tea bags containing teas from selected estates

shortDefinitions: dried leaves used to make tea

definitions: a hot drink made from the infused leaves, fruits, or flowers of other plants
shortDefinitions: drink made from plants other than tea

definitions: the evergreen shrub or small tree that produces tea leaves, native to South and eastern Asia and grown as a major cash crop.
shortDefinitions: evergreen shrub or small tree which produces tea leaves

definitions: a light afternoon meal consisting typically of tea to drink, sandwiches, and cakes

examples.text: they were about to take afternoon tea

shortDefinitions: light afternoon meal consisting of tea and sandwiches

examples.text: it reminds me of Sunday teas when I was a very small child

definitions: secret information or rumors of a scandalous nature; gossip
etymologies: 1970s: perhaps from a respelling of T, an abbreviation of truth, later popularized by African American drag culture

examples.text: the star spilled the tea on her younger sister's romantic life
he dropped a little more tea about the situation on his radio show
